intro: Tarenna celebica, commonly known as the Java tarenna, is a flowering plant native to the Maluku Islands in Indonesia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy, dark green surface. Tarenna celebica is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
